dialogues.text: Okay, partner, whatta you say we tame this bronco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny's eyes: SHAME & FEAR - doesn't want to disappoint father again, but too scared to get on the bike.  Frank reaches out, holds Johnny's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be scared.  This time I'm right behind you if you fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, Daddy, I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but we can.  We can do it together. Spirit and guts, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat.  Johnny takes a deep breath, nods OK, slowly getting on the bike.  Frank's holding on to the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your time.  I'm not gonna let go 'til you say okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny takes a gulp of air, starts pedaling.  Slowly movi forward.  The bike picks up some speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm right here behind you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's still running alongside, holding on to the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank lets go.  Johnny keeps pumping those little six-yea old legs.  A bit wobbly at first, but he's gonna make it. Johnny's eyes: determination & self-confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clapping) Yes!  That's it!  You got it, you got it! Way to go, Chief!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing it!  I'm doing it!

dialogues.speaker: ON FRANK'S FACE
dialogues.text: The proud father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Atta boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny blissfully riding around Frank in a big gentle cir Frank slowly spins around keeping his eyes on his Little Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John walks in the front door, takes off his coat... The house looks different.  Cleaner, furnishings less rag John moves through his home, taking in the subtle changes He reaches the study.  And there, beside the desk, is something that makes him stop: A PHOTOGRAPH on the wall beside the desk -- FRANK, JULIA FOURTEEN YEAR-OLD JOHNNY SULLIVAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The picture changed.  John aged from 6 to 14.  Julia's hairstyle and clothes changed from 60's to 70's.  Frank's hair receded and grayed.  Jon is staring at evidence of a history that didn't exist before. John grabs the old family scrapbook he found in Frank's trunk.  Opens it, unfolds "FIREMAN KILLED" CLIPPING. The main headline still reads: "OCTOBER 13, 1969.  AMAZIN

dialogues.speaker: TAKE GAME 2. 2-1 LEAD. SEE SPORTS."
dialogues.text: But the sub headline now reads: "FIREMAN RESCUES RUNAWAY

dialogues.speaker: INFERNO"
dialogues.text: John turns, stares at the radio questioningly.  He starts sit down at the desk when he spots something on the front edge of it.  WORDS CARVED INTO THE WOOD, 29 YEARS AGO by fighter Frank Sullivan.  The day John saved his father's life: I'M STILL HERE CHIEF The last letter is missing.  But then a patch of wood sta to morph - as if it were being carved by an invisible kni A BURST OF STATIC.  RADIO CRACKLES TO LIFE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through radio) ...can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: One hand on the squawk bar, the other holds the jack-knif is using to finish carving the letter F.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through radio) Dad...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief?!  Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the voice of an angel, Johnny.  If you hadn't told me, no way I would'a ever made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank cuts himself off in mid-sentence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, you there?  You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I'm okay. (beat) What about you?  I want to know.  About you.  And your mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John hesitates for a moment.  Lights up a smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're doing all right, Dad.  We're doing good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard to explain.  Something happened today.  It was like a dream.  And when I woke up I had all these new memories. Good times.  Times we never had before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But John looks troubled.  Something bothering him.  He ta a hit off his cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I gotta tell you this...cause you should know.  Cause I still remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, Johnny?  What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What it was like when you died in the fire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both men are silent for some moments.  The hum of static. breath, then -- JOHN (cont'd) We needed you.  I needed you.  So many times...I wished for you.  But you weren't there for me. (beat) Mom tried.  But she was hurting.  I used to hear her, every night, for years, crying herself to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank grips the radio mic, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The static grows.  John leans into the mic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you think about it.  And you remember, cause I don't wanna lose you again.  I don't ever want Mom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's voice cracks, choking back the tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over static) You won't.  I swear to God you won't.  I love you, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blast of static.  The signal is gone.  It is quiet. John leans back.  Takes a breath.  Reaches out for the ph CLOSE ON PHONE'S THREE SPEED DIAL BUTTONS. John HITS #3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through answering machine) Hi, this is Julia.  Please leave a message after the tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma, it's me.  Call me.  We gotta talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As John slowly hangs up the phone, something catches his Something that wasn't there yesterday. LONGBRANCH BOYS' CLUB SWIMMING TROPHY...A GREAT SUMMER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through several glass windows a CLOCK READS: 11:52 PM. Julia and other medical personnel are working on a heart attach victim and they are winning.  She is in charge and is impressive.  Cool...efficient...expert. A sixth sense causes her to look up to see: FRANK. Standing behind the windows.  Motionless.  Gazing at his wife. Julia holds on him for a split second, concern and surpri etching across her face.  She turns back to her work, the says something to another ER nurse, who nods okay.  Satis the patient is out of the woods, she peels off her gloves heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia steps through the door as Frank approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank...what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  I just wanted to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her in his arms, snuggling his head against her neck, losing himself in the scent of her hair. FRANK (cont'd) (whisper) I'm not goin' anywhere, Jules.  For the rest of your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard to tell, we can't see his face, but it looks li Frank is crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Frank is silent.  So they just stand there, holding e other.  And then Julia notices the burn and scrape marks Frank's arms and neck. JULIA (cont'd) I got a bad feeling today...I was worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here.  Bruised but not broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank pulls his head back, looks into his wife's eyes and kisses her on the mouth.  It's a long kiss. As they come up for air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Johnny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tucked him in at Gordo's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You give him his drops?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One in each ear. (beat) What would you do without me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably marry some rich doctor and never have to work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia sees something through a glass door that stops her short.  A YOUNG INTERN is standing over a gurneyed PATIEN The YOUNG INTERN is changing the I.V. BAG. JULIA (cont'd) What's he doing?  Frank, I gotta...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows she's back on the job.  Waves "no problem."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia interrupts the Young Intern as he hooks up the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me doctor, is that Benazepril?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia quickly shuts off the I.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave this patient 50 mills of Benedryal on admittance. (unhooking I.V. bag) Mix them and he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why wasn't I made aware?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in his chart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The intern steps back: "Oh shit."  Julia takes charge. The patient stirs: a SCRAGGLY HIPPIE, looks kind of like Pacino in SERPICO.  A breathing mask covers his bearded f Barely conscious, his eyes focus on Julia. After a quick double check of the patient, Julia looks up Through the glass door she can see Frank watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouthing to words) I love you, Bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouthing back) I love you more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock on the wall now reads: 12:01 AM. And the LEGEND reads: OCTOBER 13th - WORLD SERIES TRAVEL DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEN and WOMEN, standing and sitting, seen only from teh w down.  All wearing dark cloths and speaking in hushed voi A recognizable VOICE?  The edge of a CASKET?  A NIGHTMARE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is bathed in SWEAT.  He twists to CAMERA and his eye pop open.  A glazed, confused look pours out of them. SEE past an empty bottle of BUSHMILLS on the night stand clock READS 12:01 AM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE NIGHTMARE REPEATS - like some horrible instant replay MEN and WOMEN, standing and sitting, seen only from the w down.  All wearing dark clothes and speaking in hushed voices.  FLASHES OF FACES SWIMMING INTO THE POV...indisti blurring into each other.  Is that UNCLE BUTCH?  SATCH?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A terrified and disoriented John stumbles out of bed.  He moves to the bathroom.  But he stops.  Something is wrong The bedroom has changed.  It looks like a DUMP. John shakes his head, trying to blink away the nightmare. But the room does not change back.  He goes to teh bathro Splashes his face.  He looks up to the mirror and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same horrible instant replay.  Flashes of faces swimm into the POV...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is CROUCHED UNDER A TABLE.  STARING AT THE CASKET.  Al Bewildered.  Crying. A MAN, seen only from teh waist down, approaches the tabl As he crouches down his face drops into the frame.  It is FRANK.  His face etched in a terrible pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen looks different: dirtier, uncared-for.  John looks different too: like a guy on the tail end of a life bender.  He cracks open a Bushmills.  Pours a couple of s into his instant coffee.  Several sips to settle his nerv He reaches for the cordless phone and HITS SPEED DIAL #3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noah's Deli.  Can you hold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confused, John clicks down the receiver.  His hand is sha as he punches the speed dial button for the second time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noah's Deli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the slam of John's phone, we got to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John knocks on the door.  It opens to reveal a Jamaican w clutching a crying infant, a toddler hanging off her leg. Behind them we half recognize Julia's apartment.  We know it's her apartment because of the BAY WINDOW and the view THE GEORGE WASHINGTON BRIDGE.  But everything else is different.  Different furniture.  Different pain job. John stands speechless.  The Jamaican woman regards him..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relaxed) I'm looking for Julia Sullivan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you have the wrong apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this is her place.  910 Riverside. Apartment 3C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but no one by that name lives here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John just stands there, lost, questioning his grip on reality.  Liquor on his breath, fear in his eyes, he is a scary sight.  Jamaican woman does the smart thing - she s the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SATCH, scavenging the fridge while absorbed in some papers. Through the open door he SPOTS JOHN across the squad room Even at that distance, Satch can see John's unsteady walk fucked up demeanor.  Satch's eyes go to stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John leans over the sink, wet paper towels pressed to his face.  He barely reacts to the SOUND of the door.  He doe react to the silence that follows.  Satch stands in the doorway...looking him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another rough night, huh?  That it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John moves for the door.  But Satch grabs him, slams him against the wall.  Startled, John freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not disrespect me.  Disrespect yourself all you want.  But not me.  Or anybody else around here.  You got that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John shrugs, sagging against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is getting real old, John.  And I'm tired up to here with it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I just...you know...I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm tired of the I'm sorrys.  I don't need 'em.  What I need is a partner I can count on. (pause; softens) I care about you.  Not cause of me and your old man.  Not cause of your mom. But because of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch steps back.  An awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got the preliminary forensics on that skeleton. (opening door to the squad) Your gonna want to look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch and John approach their adjoining desks.  Satch sli an 8X10 PHOTO off the top of an OLD YELLOWED POLICE FILE hands it to John.  It is a picture of the skeleton discov behind the Greek Diner.  But what catches John's attentio what picks at his subconscious, is the decaying GLASS TAP binding the wrists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad memories... (re: photo) You imagine the odds...us diggin' up a Nightingale Murder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John looks from the photo to the file on Satch's desk.  I reads: NIGHTINGALE MURDERS.  John slowly sinks into his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She makes ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten?  No.  I remember this case.  Three. He killed three women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking'?  You know better than anybody, John.  You've read this file a thousand times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John fixes on the file.  Then slowly reaches for it.  It' filled with police and forensics reports.  And PHOTOS.  C scene shots of 9 DEAD WOMEN.  Linked by TWO gruesome deta they were all GARROTED, wrists bound with GLASS TAPE. John turns over the last PHOTO and his heart stops...his universe crashing down on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia is at the door watching Frank tuck Johnny in.  John wears his Mets' cap and cradles his baseball glove.  He's that exhausted/excited kid moment before sleep sets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very soft) Buy me some peanuts and cracker jack...I don't care if I never get back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny's eyes close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy is he excited about the game tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't the only one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin Gaye plays from the HI-FI.  Frank grabs a beer, as Julia comes in -- putting on her coat while taking her ke from a hook.  She's wearing her nurse's uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to her) Wish you weren't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping to him) Do you know how much I love you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank takes her in his arms.  Starts to move her to the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, actually I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.  And dance.  And kiss.  And dance.  He starts slip her coat off.  She laughs and wriggles away from him Naughty boy.  And she is out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pulls in past SAMANTHA'S CAR as she comes out the ba door with the Teddy Bear and other stuff she left behind. John gets out of his car, clutching the 'Nightingale' fil his eyes are red, swollen by tears and booze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answer is no.  He looks terrible, as haunted as any m could possibly be.  He doesn't mean to, but he snaps --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha jumps, frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen said you were working.  I just wanted to pick up the rest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John turns, lost and ashamed.  Sam walks to her car and starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John enters, plunks the Nightingale file on the desk.;  H stares at the FAMILY PHOTOGRAPH on the wall. JULIA IS MISSING.   A look of loss in Frank and John's fa John fingers the Nightingale file.  A nightmare. He hits the ANSWERING MACHINE BUTTON to hear Samantha's halting message.  As that plays...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John steps to teh counter and pours himself a stiff Bushmills.  Turns and steps back into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John collapses in the chair.  Stares at the words carved the desk - I'M STILL HERE CHIEF.  He rubs his fingers ove the smooth carving...his eyes going to the radio. A quiet moment.  John slowly puts his hand on the squawk, leans into the mic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, you there?  Can you here me? (silence) Dad?  I need you to be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat.  The hum of static.  And then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through radio) Right here, Chief.  Sorry I lost you last night.  Damn thing keeps cutting out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad...Dad... There's... I need to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sipping Bushmills) Something happened, something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Johnny, what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta you mean she's not here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She...she died.  It's like it just happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just died, your mother just died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Dad, it happened a long time ago, a long time ago for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dreadful moment of silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: October 22, 1969.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ...that's...ten days from now. (beat) How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny, I gotta know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long beat.  You could hear a fuckin' pin drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eerie silence as John's words hang in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murdered?  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was this case.  A serial.  He murdered three women, all nurses, between '68 and '69.  The papers called them the Nightingale Murders.  They never caught him.  But the killings just stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kinda twisted animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, we did something.  Something to make it worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta you mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't just kill three women anymore. He killed ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something we did changed the case...changed history. (beat) Mom wasn't dead.  But then after you didn't die in the fire something must have happened.  And this guy, this Nightingale guy, he kept on killing...it was like a spree...seven more women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta take her away, John.  I'm gonna take your mother away.  He can't hurt her if I take her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... (beat) What about the other women?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll warn them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll never work.  They'll just think you're crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can we do?  You don't even know who this guy is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Nobody got... (realizing) Wait a minute.  I might not know who he is, but I know where he's gonna be.  I got the case file.  We know what he's gonna do before he does it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what should I do?  Call the police? You think they'll believe me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will if they catch him in the act. You can make that happen, Dad.  You can tail the victim and call it in at just the right moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, John.  I'm a fire fighter. This is...this is different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do know.  I'm a cop.  This is what I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John takes a long sip from the Bushmills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever talk to a victim's family?  The one's left behind?  They don't act like what you'd think.  There's panic and fear.  But mostly, it's like there's this logic problem.  And if they could only solve it, everything would be okay. (a breath) But if you look real close - look at their eyes - you can see it.  Just a glimmer.  But somewhere they know.  They know their world is never gonna be the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if the radio stops working?  Christ, what if I can't reach you again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you get Mom the hell out.  But Dad, those other women weren't supposed to die.  We don't try to stop this guy, we're gonna live with that for the rest of our lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank takes a deep breath, swallows some air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I gotta do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John grabs the THICK YELLOWED POLICE FILE.  Opens to homi report on Karen Reynolds.  CLOSE ON FORENSIC PHOTO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next victim was Karen Reynolds...It happens tomorrow. (reading) Case file says she left St. Vincents at six.  Show'd up at Cozy's Bar around six thirty.  She walked outta that bar around seven-thirty.  They found her dead in an empty lot behind the place at eight o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank jots down teh info.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not just get the cops to watch the bar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll question her.  Whatever they tell her could change what happens. (beat) No, I want you to follow her.  See if anybody's watching her, hittin' on her. I'm betting somebody's gonna walk outta that bar with her.  When they do, you call the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on NIGHTINGALE FILE on John's desk.  Zoom in on the date below KAREN'S HOMICIDE PHOTO: October 14, 1969. The LEGEND reads: OCTOBER 14th - 3RD GAME OF THE WORLD SERIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman waits to pay for a mini pack of Kleenex and some KAREN REYNOLDS.  A wool coat over her Nurse's uniform. Frank's and John's voices continue over the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I tell them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell 'em there's a homicide in progress... cause by the time they show up there will be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Karen moves to the cash register, the CAMERA WIDENS TO REVEAL FRANK, awkwardly pretending to read a magazine. Frank readies to follow her when he suddenly trips over a crate of vegetables and goes down on one knee. Karen looks in the direction of the accident, and for a s second, her eyes lock with Frank's.  Embarrassed, Frank l away as he rights himself. Frank edges out of the grocery store as Karen steps into street and dodges traffic towards a corner BAR/RESTAURANT the end of the block, past a heavily overgrown VACANT LOT Frank follows Karen across the street and finds himself, as Karen enters the bar, at a point near the murder site described by John.  He pauses to stare at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank enters the place.  Sort of a singles atmosphere, bu comfortable one.  It's HAPPY HOUR.  On the TV, the Mets' Hodges offers his analysis of Game 3. Frank looks about, down the bar and into an area with boo and tables.  A few folks at the bar.  A group of YOUNG WO laughing in a booth.  But NO KAREN REYNOLDS.  Frank's blo runs cold in a spasm of panic when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank wheels around just as Karen passes him from teh LAD ROOM.  There is the trace of a bump, enough for Karen to note of Frank.  Ad lib EXCUSE ME.  She then starts moving down teh bar towards the booth of young women. Frank checks out everyone in the bar, not knowing quite w he's looking for. Karen slips into the booth with her friends.  Ad lib HELL Frank orders a beer, but his eyes are fixed on the booth. Karen and a friend take note of Frank staring at them. Embarrassed, he turns away, checking his watch: 6:40PM. at just that moment a SCRAGGLY MAN passes by, taking a se at the end of the bar.  We have seen this man before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch and a YOUNG DETECTIVE stand at the sinks, washing u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that really how you got the Son of Sam?  Parking tickets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch shrugs a yes.  Wipes his hands and heads out into t squad.  The Young Detective follows.

dialogues.speaker: SQUAD ROOM WALL CLOCK
dialogues.text: John's at his desk.  Keeps glancing at the phone, fiddlin with the NIGHTINGALE FILE... A PHOTOGRAPH OF KAREN REYNOL Satch passes John on his way to the coffee machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any word on our bones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John shakes his head no.  Young Detective joins Satch at coffee machine.  John overhears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how'd you think of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pulling over with a .44 bulldog tucked in your pants getting ready to blow somebody's brains out...I  figure the last thing you're thinking about is alternate side of the street parking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Detective nods, impressed.  John is less impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what we need here, Satch.  A lucky break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't luck, Johnny boy.  That was smarts and ten plus on the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOTTLE OF RHEINGOLD drops into frame next to half empty o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the girls, pal.  All of 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank glances at the women in the booth.  They're all loo at him, smiling.  A big one from Karen. His watch says 7:05.  Taking the new bottle, Frank steps the bar, past the Scraggly Man and walks to the booth. Charmingly shy, Frank is kind of at a loss for words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was, uh, I'm not really...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noting Frank's jacket) Fireman, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noting wedding ring) A married fireman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, what the hell.  Have a seat.  What's your name, fireman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Frank takes a seat, sliding in next to Karen.  An awk moment for him as she takes a closer look at his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I know you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puts it together) From the Korean market up the street. (laughing) Mr. Lee make you pay for those veggies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You following her, Frank?  You're not some kind of stalker or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I follow fires, nothing else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General laughter all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John has a CORKBOARD set up next to his desk.  On it he h arrayed several photos of the Nigthingale victims under t dates of their murders.  He looks over at the photos, the the forensics photo of Karen Reynolds on his desk.  BRRIN John shoots a look at the wall clock.  It reads: 7:45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing the phone) Sullivan. (beat) You're kiddin'... (grabbing pen; scribbling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch is alerted by John's sudden burst of energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mario, you are the best...right, right, right.  Spell it out for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the bar, the Scraggly Man stares at Frank and the wome Franks checks his watch as he tells a story.  It's 7:50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was a close call, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close!  The news said it was a miracle you guys got out alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close is just close if you're still alive to talk about it, y'know/

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women around him are clearly enraptured. In B.G. - at the bar - the Scraggly Man, looking frustrat slides off his stool and strides out of the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John hangs up the phone.  Satch looks at him, "Whatta we got?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our lucky break.  Mario ID'd the dental. Mary Finelli...reported missing April 16, 1968.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at corkboard) April 16...?  That means she was the first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which means he probably knew her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This case just got hot.  We pull on this string...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But for some strange reason John has stopped listening to Satch.  Something else has got his full attention.  It is Nightingale file that lays open on his desk.  It is changing...Karen Reynolds' forensic photo disappears. In everything about her, all evidence of her murder - police reports, photos, witness reports - is GONE. John's eyes shoot to the corkboard.  The head shot of Kar Reynolds and the date of her murder are also GONE.  John looks between the file and the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whisper) Dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Julia stand on the porch, eyes on Johnny - up p bedtime, proudly riding his bike up and down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a stretch and a yawn) I think I'm gonna head up, take a shower. (slight smile) You wanna tuck the monster in and join me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank doesn't take the bait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something I gotta take care of. Something I need to tell you about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been talking to this...guy...this cop...on the HAM...and, uh, he...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, what is it?  Just tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been talking to Johnny...on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  He loves that thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Not our Johnny.  I mean, it's Johnny...but not now...in the future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes her a moment to absorb what he just said.  And t she gets it... he's talking about a game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him on the forehead and heads into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be upstairs...if you want to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet beat.  And then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over static) Karen Reynolds is alive and well.  We did it, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the HAM) I'll be damned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see him?  Do you know who he is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I just kept talking to her. (beat) There was a lot of guys in that bar - could'a been any of 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  This is working.  This is gonna work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta we do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (consults file) Sissy Clark, 190 Riverside Dr., apartment 3C.  Tomorrow. (skimming file) She's a nursing student.  Paying her way as a cocktail waitress at the Peppermint Lounge, on west 63rd.  Left work at two A M...killed in her apartment, between two thirty and five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank jots down the info.  Fires up a Lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I think I may be able to get you enough information to make sure the DA can nail this bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coupla days ago they dug up a body in Washington Heights - Mary Finelli.  Girl disappeared in '68.  Turns out she was his first kill.  Which means he probably knew her.  Most serials know their first victim.  I'm gonna do some checking - see if I can put any of this together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I'm with you. (beat) I just hope we know what the hell we're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A soft burst of static.  The signal returns a little fuzz

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me something good, Chief.  Tell me about the future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lighting up a Marlboro) Well they found out cigarettes give you lung cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank takes a beat, contemplating the cigarette in his ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else, John.  It must be different, huh?  Are people living on the moon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't happen, we got enough problems down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we like in...1998?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lying) We're okay...we're good, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groping for good news) Hey, what about the Amazin's?  They pull it off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really wanna know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you betcha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, game five was the big one.  It turned in the bottom of the 6th.  We were down 3-0.  Cleon Jones gets hit on the foot - left a scuff mark on the ball. Clendenon comes up.  The count goes to 2 2.  High fastball.  He nailed it.  Weis slammed a solo shot in the 7th to tie. Jones and Swoboda scored in the 8th.  We won, Pop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia walks into the study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on a sec, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the HAM) You there?

dialogues.speaker: ON FRANK
dialogues.text: realizing something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules, I want you to say hello to somebody... (re: radio) I'm on with John - that guy I told you about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The future guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but, no kidding around, he's a good guy, a real good guy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sensing that somehow this is important to her husband, Ju gives in, willing to play along with his radio game.  She shares Frank's chair, he puts his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, say hello to my wife...Julia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H-hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, future boy.  Frank tells me you're a cop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing voices, Johnny, Gordo and Elvis wander in from th family room.  They are in their pj's...a sleepover.  Juli gives them a smile, turns back to the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My six year-old here keeps telling me he wants to be a policeman.  Right after he retires from the majors.  We just gave him a badge and a whistle for his birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...I remember. (smiling) I used to play cops and robbers but y-- ...my mom wouldn't let me have a toy gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're mom sounds like she's got some smarts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's pretty special.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a good cop, John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I try to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll bet she's real proud of you, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I just wish I'd told her how proud I was of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I didn't realize... (beat) But she knew, John.  A mother knows what's in her son's heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Gordo reaches for the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better go.  It's been good talking with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia scoops Johnny up, carrying him off to bed.  But lit Gordo does not follow...fascinated by the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna talk on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank laughs, as Gordo climbs up on his lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Space Cowboy.  I'm an intergalactic traveler from the Federation planet earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know my name, mister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits back, marvelling at how young Gordo sounds.  A thousand childhood memories playing in his head.  And the lights up...realizing the opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Gordo.  My name is Santa Clause. And I'm gonna give you the biggest Christmas present you ever had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordo looks at Frank: is this for real?  Frank nods, smil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better give you my address then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh don't worry kid, I know where you live.  Now I want you to go upstairs and write this down, buy Yahoo. You got that Space Cowboy.  Y-a-h-o-o. It's a magic word and I never want you to forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a deal, mister.  I mean Santa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of Julia's voice calling Gordo to bed.  Gordo scampers out.  Static filters through both radios, then..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, you still there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm right here, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Chief.  I'm not gonna let anything happen to her...no matter what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BZZZZ-SHHH.  A burst of loud static.  The band goes dead. John takes a beat to come down.  He gets up, making his w into the KITCHEN.  There's a half-full bottle of BUSHMILL the counter.  John reaches out to grab but the bottle.  B then he stops.  It is time to stop.  John turns on the fa and dumps the booze down the drain. The LEGEND reads: OCTOBER 15th - FOURTH GAME OF THE WORLD SERIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a white vinyl DIARY with a blue heart shaped padlock held a hand.  A page is turned and the name ALAN SILVER comes clear.

dialogues.speaker: RACK FOCUS TO
dialogues.text: an old Catholic High School yearbook on the dresser below diary and a PICTURE of DARYL ADAMS, 18 years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I keep these for a little while?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On SOPHIA FINELLI, 55, a profound sadness sits at her cor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detectives' been through that stuff already back then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John nods.  A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll bring them back soon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pulls a clear plastic BAG from his pocket with a pat of the partially disintegrated clothing found on Mary Finellis skeleton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Finelli gasps in recognition, her eyes turning to a closet door. John opens the door to reveal MARY's CLOTHES, lined up in perfect order.  Visible among them is a "Candy Striper" uniform... a perfect match with the patch John holds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary volunteered over at St. Vincents' after school.  She loved it...was going to become a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.  Tears start to run down her cheeks.  John understands this woman's pain.  He looks around the room Mary's possessions.  Faded pictures.  Mary and her family Mary and her friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her room...I just couldn't...it should only be her room...you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John does know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm happy you found her, Detective.  It makes it easier...now, to know for sure. You know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence again.  John nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Satch stand at the urinals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, lemme walk you through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I shake it off first...so's I can concentrate better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John waits for Satch to finish.   Then, as they head out the hallway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three guys show up in both the yearbook and diary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first guy passed away ten years ago.  The second one in Vietnam. The room has a HOLDING PEN opposite the door.  A table is pushed up against the door wall and a more elaborate layo of the murder victims, paperwork, and calendar/timeline graphs sit on the table and are pinned on a cork board. Finelli's uniform is there. John shows Satch a photo in Mary Finelli's year book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The third one is Daryl Adams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch looks, nods, and steps back.  Waits for more.  John hands him Daryl Adams' rap sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ran him through BCI...got a hit. Busted for sexual assault: March 22, 1970.  Eight days after the last Nightingale murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you figure the murders stop 'cause he's off the street.  Then by the time he gets paroled, he's smartened up enough to control himself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the first time that's been true.  I'm telling you, I got a feeling about this guy.  This is the guy, Satch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just trying to figure what interests me more: the possibility that Daryl is the guy, or you making him absolutely the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SISSY CLARK steps off a BUS.  She crosses the street towa the club.  The bus moves out and WIPES FRAME, revealing F sitting at the intersection on his Harley. Sissy enters the club.  Frank guns the Harley into an all

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Business is light at this hour.  The BARTENDER is setting The Flying Nun plays on a couple TV's over the bar - the audio drowned out by loud Motown music. Frank enters and looks around.  No Sissy.  This time he d not panic.  He sits at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the 47-year old face of Daryl Adams.  A notably unimposin guy.  He is not a happy camper. He is one of two PLUMBERS installing fixtures in the kitc of a new place.  Several other people are at work getting kitchen ready.  So as not to be overheard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was over thirty years ago.  I paid for that and then some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go to Xavier High School, Daryl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember Mary Finelli?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mentally steps back) What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I'm saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAWAII FIVE-O plays on the TV's, the ROLLING STONES over Frank sits at the same place we last saw him, watching Si and scanning the crowd, trying to find a face that might him pause. Sissy, looking sixty and terrific in her Go-Go waitress outfit, moves about doing business.  She steps to the bartender t0 give her drink orders and pick up prepared drinks, coming within inches of Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a couple Bloodys, Gus, and a Dewars on the rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She casts a friendly eye at Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya doin' there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just fine.  You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now, just fine.  Ask me later, fireman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she's off with the drinks.  He checks his watch.  It reads: 9:35PM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clock on the wall reads: 9:35PM The Nightingale murders display has been removed.  Daryl at the table in the middle of the room.  John sits opposi him.  Satch leans against the two-way mirror wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sexual assault, Daryl.  Five years.  But you got lucky, right?  You got away with something else.  Something you figured nobody knows about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I know is what I told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you what I know, Daryl.  You went to Saint Xavier with Mary.  You lived five blocks from her.  You liked her.  But she ain't interested.  That must've hurt, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what'd you do about it, Daryl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch can see this is going nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 11 O'clock NEWS is on TV.  A "Super" shows the Mets w Game 4.  Score 2-1.  Mets lead series: 3-1. CREEDENCE CLEARWATER PLAYS out of the sound system. Sissy takes the order from a LONG HAIRED GUY  down the ba his back to the camera, and starts towards the cash regis area.  The bartender serves Frank another club soda.  As Frank drinks the bartender pulls a PACK OF CIGARETTES fro his shirt pocket.  But the pack is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You spare a smoke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to quite.  Turns out those things'll kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bartender laughs, as Frank stands and heads for the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLOCK reflected in the two-way mirror.  12:15PM. Satch stands drinking a cup of coffee behind the mirror. Before him, through the glass, sits Daryl Adams, with Joh pacing like a panther ready to spring. Suddenly, he slaps down crime scene homicide photos of several women in front of Daryl, who blanches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God!  What is that?!  Why you showing me this shit!?  JESUS!  JESUS! Get those away from me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky Moore.  Patty Ryan.  Mary Finelli. These names mean anything to you, asshole?  Julia Sullivan!  She mean anything?  She means something to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John looks like he's about to hit Daryl, but he glances towards the two-way mirror, controls himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nilsson's EVERYBODY'S TALKIN' fills the air. A sexy WOMAN approaches Frank wearing an Emma Peel body s Sissy stands nearby, giving drink orders to the bartender she can't help but smile at the following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fight fires, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.  That's what I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bartender leans into the PA at the bar and announces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank flashes his wedding ring at the sexy woman.  Smiles her and shrugs "I'm sorry."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock reads 1:30AM. John sits at the end of the table, opposite Daryl.  His q masks the dark menace he is barely in control of.  Daryl stares at him like a deer caught in the headlights. Satch sets a Coke before Daryl and starts to leave the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta take a leak. (to Daryl) You need to use the head?  You can, y'know.  If you want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daryl shakes his head "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End of the night.  The place winds down.  An old movie on TV's.  Elvis' SUSPICIOUS MINDS plays softly. Frank watches as Sissy picks up her last tip and heads to back to change into her street clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you, Fireman.  Don't talk so much next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank smiles, checks the time.  2:00AM.  He looks around. Nobody suspicious about.  He starts up for the bathroom..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch enters with a fresh cup of coffee, settles back to watch.

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATION AND OBSERVATION ROOMS
dialogues.text: With great ceremony John removes his watch, his gun, and lastly, his badge, and sets them off to one side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Daryl, sometimes, despite all the training we cops go through. Despite all that we are taught about right and wrong.  Despite all that we would like to honor in ourselves, we can come to a place where we don't give a fuck.  Know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And John starts up from his seat and walks toward Daryl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are going to tell me what I need to know, Daryl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY, in the door strides...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John freezes.  Looks towards Satch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch opens the door and steps out.  John collects his wa badge and gun and follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't our guy, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just cause he didn't want to look at the photos doesn't mean he isn't the doer. Not everyone fits the profile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he was gonna give something up he would'a done it already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pauses for several seconds, then nods slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSPICIOUS MINDS filters in.  Frank zips up, heads to the sink.  Bends over to wash his hands, and suddenly. His face is smashed on the edge of the sink.  He twists t the floor, fighting to maintain consciousness. A black Frye boot explodes into Frank's gut.  He rolls ov looks up at the LONG HAIRED GUY from the bar.  Frank seem recognize him.  We know him too - SCRAGGLY MAN.  But we d know his name yet.  So we'll call him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You following me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killer's eyes, evil fuckin' black dots.  He lifts Frank t his knees.  Then rips a fist into Frank's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked you a question, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is clearly incapacitated.  Killer lifts him to his so they are eye-to-eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely able to speak) Mary Finelli...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of absolute shock wipes across the Killer's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caught off guard, Frank is able to slam his knee into Killer's balls.  Killer goes down like a stone, but Frank too battered to take advantage. He collapses on top of Killer, who pushes him off, scramb up, and delivers a massive kick to his head.  Frank is ou cold. Quickly, Killer rolls Frank over and rifles his pockets finding his WALLET.  He grabs something from it, then tos it aside.  He then takes something out of his pocket, a t leather garrote.  He coils it around his hands and snaps taut.  He bends down to start the job when suddenly, the bathroom door opens and... TWO very stoned MEN stumble in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, dude.  Is he okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  He just needs a little time kissing the porcelain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Killer muscles Frank into a toilet stall and puts his head in the bowl.  He closes the door, quickly leaving. In the stall, Frank spills onto the floor, his legs stick out into the bathroom.  His face flush to the tile, his e trying to focus on something lying just outside the stall His WALLET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John gets in his car.  Sits there, staring into the night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank starts to come around.  He reaches out and grabs hi wallet off the floor.  His money still there.  Credit car too.  But something's missing.  His DRIVER'S LICENSE. SUDDENLY PANIC SEIZES FRANK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank tears up the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank bangs on it.  Scared.  Desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN UP, OPEN THE DOOR...ah...ummm...THIS IS THE POLICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank keeps banging on the door.  A NEIGHBOR'S DOOR swing open a crack.  AN OLD LADY peers out from behind a securi chain.  Frank stops banging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Ma'am.  I'm the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Lady skeptically looking him up & down - noticing Fra bruised face.  She quickly closes the door. Frank reaches inside his jacket pocket, pulls out a small bent metal wire, homemade LOCKPICK.  He goes to work on Sissy's lock.  CLICK, CLICK, CLICK - got it.  He opens th door, steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark.  And then a sound...scratching and popping, th sound of a PHONOGRAPH NEEDLE makes when it reaches the en the vinyl and is scratching against the label. The wind catching a curtain allows the shaft of a street light to beam brightly into the room, and in one swift moment, Frank is staring at a NIGHTMARE: Sissy Clark's murdered body.  Her dress hiked above her waist.  Her pan ripped off.  Paper stuffed into her mouth. Her hands boun with glass tape.  Frank is transfixed and sickened by Sis twisted face, her eyes frozen open in horrible death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank staggers out of the building towards his Harley.  H bends over and blows his dinner, then mounts the bike and kicks the motor over.  As he roars off down the street, W SEE in the building window... THE OLD LADY looking down at him. The LEGEND reads: OCTOBER 16th - FIFTH GAME OF THE WORLD SERIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed her John.  He killed her and I didn't do a thing to stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your fault, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it is...we did this.  We changed everything. (pausing) I've been having bad dreams, Johnny. Dreams where I die...in the fire. (soft) I was supposed to die in that warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank.  Trembling, overcome by an awful combination of fe guilt and shame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is wrong...it's like we cheated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know... (beat) But Dad, you can't go back.  You didn't die in that fire.  And no matter what you do, nothing is gonna change that.  So all we can do is deal with this...and try to make it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I can.  I'm not a cop.  I can't.   I can't stop this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we can, we can do it together. Spirit and guts, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny, I know, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank starts to light up a Lucky.  But he stops, stubbing cigarette out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to believe in me.  To believe that we can do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, he's got my driver's license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took my driver's license, John, he knows where we live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took your wallet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he tossed the wallet, but he kept the license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He touched your wallet!  Where's your wallet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got him!  Dad you got him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His prints.  You've got his prints.  I'll run them through criminal index.  You gotta get me that wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell am I gonna do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks) Listen to me, very carefully, take your wallet out, just touch it on the corners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Dad, just do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank does as John asks.  Taking out his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, now I need you to tape it up on the outside, where he touched it, so the prints keep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you gotta hide it somewhere. Somewhere where nobody's gonna find it...for 29 years! (looking around the room) Put it under the loose floorboard by the window!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting it now) I gotcha, I gotcha Chief!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna work, Dad.  We're gonna stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank fishes around the desk drawer for some electrical tape...quickly ripping off strips of tape...covering the wallet.  Then he goes to the window.  Crouches on the flo digging his nails around edges of the loose floorboard.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO JOHN
dialogues.text: getting up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the HAM) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John scrambles to window.  Crouches down on floor, reachi to find: FRANK'S WALLET COVERED IN ELECTRICAL TAPE! John goes back to the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in business.  Just sit tight...and don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And John is up, grabs gun & shield.  Sprints for the door

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER IS SEARCHING FOR A MATCH.
dialogues.text: BINGO.  The right screen freezes.  A THUMB PRINT... A MAT Pull back to reveal John, standing over a forensic comput technician, HECTOR.  Hector hits a few more keys, a photograph pops on the screen - it is NOT DARYL ADAMS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector hits another key, the man's name and photo pops up

dialogues.speaker: CARL SHEPARD
dialogues.text: HE'S 30 YEARS OLDER than when he tangled with Frank in th men's room last night, but this is the killer- Carl Shepa Below Shepard's photo, various biographical information: social security, address, current employment, and a New Y City Police Department Discharge - September 1973.

dialogues.speaker: ON JOHN
dialogues.text: A strange look of recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old neighbor's son...the cop.  But he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talkin' about?  I know this prick.  He worked outta Brooklyn North.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing) He never died...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John exits his car to find Fred Shepard watering his plan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just came by to wrap up over there. Thought I'd say "hello."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad you did.  Come on in.  Buy you a cup of coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the living room.  No Mrs. Shepard.  John's eye fix on the police academy graduation PHOTO of CARL SHEPAR His gaze then shifts to photos of Mrs. Shepard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Wife around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a startled half-laugh) No.  No.  Well, sort of.  In my heart. Been dead 29 years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Sorry.  How so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she, Eve was murdered, Detective. An ugly one to tell you the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's breath catches.  His look shifts back to the photo Carl Shepard. Mr. Shepard reaches to open an album.  There are several photographs of the young Mrs. Shepard.  A couple where sh dressed in a NURSE'S UNIFORM. John is stunned.  One can only imagine what is now racing through his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mother of a cop, and they never found the bastard who did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blown away, John looks out the window to where Mary Finel skeleton was found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happens that way sometimes. (beat) Son still on the job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.  Doin' P.I. work now.  Got caught up in them Knapp Hearings.  Set up by some dirty cops who needed a fall guy.  Hurt him bad.  Would've broken his mother's heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John can only stay inside himself and wonder at the madne of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John walks past the lunchtime crowd, makes his way to the BAR.  Grabs a stool two...seats away from...Carl Shepard. John orders a soda, glances over at Shepard.  Their eyes meet.  John holds his gaze.  A slight nod...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You used to be on the job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, long time ago.  I know you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look familiar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking him over) No.  What house you work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John gets up, slides next to Shepard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 2-3.  Homicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hot shot, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, just working the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact, I caught a case that goes back to your day...one of the Nightingale murders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kiddin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Missing teenager.  Disappeared thirty years ago.  Found her bones last week.  Buried behind some old diner, up by Dyckman street.  Mary Finelli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John waits again for Shepard's reaction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sipping drink) Talk about dumb luck.  Odds of anybody finding that girl, thirty years later. And then the chances of hitting a dental...forget about it.  Bets part is she's the first victim.  She knew the doer.  I'm betting those bones are gonna do a lot of talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepard says nothing, but his eyes are burning into John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The past is a funny thing.  We've all got skeletons in the closet.  You just never know when they're gonna pop up and bite you in the ass, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John slips something on the bar, next to Shepard.  It is crime scene photo of Shepard's murdered mother.  He reels back, totally losing his veil of composure.  He is freake

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the train wreck you didn't see coming.  And I'm gonna steal your life away.  You went down 30 years ago.  You just don't know it yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, John gets up, leaving Shepard stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny and Gordo sit cross-legged in front of the TV.  TH WORLD SERIES is on.  Game 5.  First inning. Julia is busy bringing in groceries from her car. INTERCUT FRANK AND JOHN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're telling me this maniac is a cop? What the hell am I supposed to do with that one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the FBI.  Use a pay phone.  Don't give 'em your name, Dad.  Just tell 'em that it was Shepard who killed Finelli and Clark and the others.  That he's the Nightingale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the B.G. of Frank's house a DOORBELL RINGS.  Julia can seen going to answer it.  It is Satch.  There are ad lib greetings that we don't clearly hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them where Finelli's body is buried. They'll be able to connect him to her. Same high school.  Same class.  I'm betting they search his place they find some souvenirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch steps into the study...1969.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm on it. (sees Satch) Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's hand lifts off the squawk bar.  He notes Satch's and demeanor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here, Satch?  You off today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the HAM) Dad, you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, we need to talk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) John, hold on a second. (to Satch) I'm in the middle of something important here.  You mind if...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank suddenly spots something through the front window. Satch's partner, PHIL HAYES, and TWO UNIFORMS out at the curb. Half a penny drops.  All his senses go on alert.  And instinct kicks...he hits the squawk bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch, you gotta just give me...Satch is here John.  You hear me?  Satch is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Frank, but you need to come outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank releases the squawk bar. Johnny and Gordo remain fixed on the game, oblivious to anything else.  In the kitchen, we can see Julia moving around putting away the groceries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the HAM) Dad, what the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mic) Just a minute, John...okay?  Don't go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia now becomes aware of the tension in the voices in t other room.  She looks outside and sees Phil and the uniforms.  She looks at Frank and Satch with confusion. Frank hits the squawk bar again.  He wants John to hear t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is going on here, Satch?  What are those guys doing out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you know, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go outside and talk.  We need to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.  Do us both a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat.  Frank sees Julia staring at them.  She is n bundle of growing anxiety.  Frank stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (to Julia) It's okay, Bud.  I'll be right back. (into radio) Stay there, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then he and Satch walk out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and towards a spot halfway between the house and the c From inside the house, Johnny and Gordo have begun to tak the activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you last night, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the penny drops.  Frank stalls, trying to thi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where I found this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he hands FRANK his missing DRIVER'S LICENSE.  Frank l like a truck hit him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 415 Greenwich St.  #302.  Under the body of a murdered woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  This isn't what you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna be wrong here.  But we need to go to the precinct and talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay.  I need to go say something to Julia and finish up with the guy on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can talk to Julia.  Forget the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank nods.  Takes stock of the cops by the cars and head back into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia, who has been watching through a front room window Johnny, moves to meet Frank.  Behind Frank, Satch signals Phil and the uniforms that all is okay, giving Frank a co of steps on him. Frank steps into the house and wraps his arms around Juli turning so he can see both Satch outside and where he wan to go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, Bud.  Do that for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank moves Julia toward teh desk, lulling Satch a moment then quickly steps to the HAM radio and hits the squawk b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the HAM) Yeah, Dad.  What the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch is busting me for Sissy Clark's murder.  John...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia stares dumbfounded at Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch strides by Julia and reaches to take Frank's elbow. Frank wheels at the sound of his name and the touch, and lurches back from Satch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you gotta help me, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and the movement yanks the mic cord to the radio tight dragging it to the edge of the desk. Johnny tears into the room and clutches onto his mother. "Daddy, Daddy!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the deal, Frank.  Don't do this to your family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Frank throws his hands up in front of his chest in an give up" gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!  Dad!  What's going on?  Satch?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the HAM radio CRASHES to the floor in 1969.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1998.  The HAM RADIO TRANSFORMING...a large dent appearin its casing before John's eyes...dials cracking. Dread creeps into John's face as we SMASH CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see what John sees in 1998.  But we also go inside his mind and glimpse flashes of new childhood memories.  Memo of seeing his father arrested for murder.  Images that ma JOHNNY'S POV from moments ago in 1969.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits at a metal table bolted to the floor, Satch si across.  Phil stands.  Two cups of coffee on the table. room is very bare.  Cinder block walls. Padded locks and bars over the windows.  A small metal cabinet against the far wall.  Satch and Phil smoke.  Fra does not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl Shepard.  Detective out of the 15th precinct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch stares at Frank with utter incredulity.  Phil light smoke, tossing the pack and the matchbook on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear, Satch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, huh... (beat) Uh, huh.  And you got this from the guy you were talking to on the radio when I came in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As nuts as that sounds, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch, would you listen to me here.  Just you and me.  Can I talk to you here, alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch looks over at Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a little time with this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil nods his understanding, steps out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, this is not the time to be worried about covering up if you had a thing with this girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not gonna stop, Satch.  He's gonna keep on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you listening to me?  You're in a world of shit.  An eye witness has you outside the dead girl's apartment.  We got your prints all over the place.  Plus the fucking driver's license, Frank. (beat) You gotta give me something here. Something I can believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quiet for a moment.  And then a sound filters in und the door.  The sound of cops cheering.  It's the World Series. Frank sits up - takes a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I could prove it to you, Satch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
