dialogues.text: What if I told you that in the bottom of the 6th we're gonna be down 3-0.  And Cleon Jones is gonna get hit in the foot. It's gonna leave a scuff mark on the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next batter, Clendenon, hits one outta the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, this is insane...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the bottom of the 7th, Weis is gonna hit a solo home run.  Jones and Swoboda are gonna score in the 8th.  The Mets are gonna win 5-3. (beat) Go watch the game, Satch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go watch the game?  Go watch the fucking game?  Frank, they're gonna make you for Sissy Clark's murderer.  It matches the Nightingale's profile.  You understand what that means?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the bolt slide, the knob turns and the door opens

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His wife is here.  She wants to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch nods okay to Phil.  He closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta you want me to tell her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank struggles for an answer...but comes up speechless. Satch looks like his heart is breaking.  Unable to compre how Frank could have slipped this far.  A long beat, then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in harm's way.  He's gonna be coming for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch snorts, incredulous.  Frank reaches over the table takes his hand, deadly serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me, as a friend.  October 22, don't let her out of your sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch nods okay.  They have an understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch walks down the stairs.  Julia alone on the bench. She sees Satch approaching, stands up, looking at him for answer, for an explanation...for hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Let's walk, get a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia nods okay.  They exit the precinct house and into..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the street.  Around the corner we catch sight of someo familiar - someone Julia and Satch don't recognize: Shepa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepard approaches the desk, flashes his shield at Sergea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a collar in here for the Nightingale murders?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working with one of the victims outta Brooklyn North.  You mind I take a shot at him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Deleon and Hayes' collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just missed Deleon.  Hayes is up in the squad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the collar, in the cells?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think he's up in interrogation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go find Hayes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepard turns, gliding through the lobby like a shark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch and Julia sit at a booth in the back.  Satch stirs coffee, trying to start a very hard conversation.  As he struggles to begin, the camera notices something in the B At the counter: a few stray people gathered around watchi the WORLD SERIES on an old TV. AUDIO COMES UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepard passes the COFFEE ROOM.  It is packed with detectives, gathered around a TV...watching the game.  Ph Hayes is among them.  And as Shepard passes, Phil half catches a glimpse of him as he glides down the hall and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks up to see Shepard, who quickly closes the doo behind him... and unholsters his gun.  An eerie moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On your feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank waits a beat.  Then very slowly, he stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now turn around, face the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank steps back, slowly turning.  Shepard holsters the g Kicks Frank up against the wall as he reaches into his po and takes out the leather garrote we saw in the Peppermin Lounge Bathroom.  He coils it around his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (facing the wall) You twisted animal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evidence says you're the animal. (snapping garrote tight) That's why you hung yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Frank turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You try putting that thing around my neck and I'll rip your throat out.  You want me dead, use the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepard smiles, unfazed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me draw you a picture.  You live at 1060 41st Ave.  You have a wife who works at New York Hospital.  And a six-year old at P.S. 130.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepard gives Frank a look that would make a Marine Drill Sergeant shit his pants.  Shepard knows Frank's weakness, one thing that would make him submit to death. Closing his eyes, Frank turns to face the wall...But the handle rattles, someone is outside coming in.  Shepard quickly yanks Frank away from the wall, shoving him in a chair at the interrogation table. The door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to help me.  He's trying to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepard just laughs.  Phil scans the room - everything lo normal, a cop questioning a perp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if we take it outside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil shrugs okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Frank) I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepard and Phil step out - bolting the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepard and Phil stand outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...didn't mean t step on your toes.  They sent me up from downstairs, I thought you'd be in there with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking at him for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's expression begins to harden.  His eyes search teh room.  CLOSE ON his EYES.  He looks like John - controlle rage piercing through that Sullivan thousand yard stare. He stands, turning around, looking for something, anythin that he can use to get the hell out of there. His mind's racing, fire fighter training kicking in.  And then he looks up - just below the ceiling, above the door 2'X2' ELECTRICAL CONDUCTOR BOX. Follow Frank's eyes to something else.  An AIR CONDITIONE MOUNTED IN THE WINDOW. Frank goes to the window.  Runs his fingers along the air conditioner's thick electrical cord - thinking.  He unplu it.  And then he RIPS cord out of the unit, exposing wire

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loud cheer rises out of the coffee room - the game is heating up.  Shepard and Phil are still standing outside interrogation room.  Shepard flashes a smile, having said something that makes Phil laugh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, half the uniforms are either at the game or on the street.  It's gonna be a riot if they pull it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing down the hall - in direction of sound of TV) What's the score?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia's crying.  Satch has no words to comfort her, now w of explaining any of this.  He reaches out across the table...taking her hand.  And as they sit quietly. CAMERA tracks towards the counter.  And we hear something that Satch does not.  The sound of a voice.  TV ANNOUNCER THE SERIES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cleon Jones thinks he's hit.  I think the ball hit him in the foot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank uses the heel of his shoe to rip the plug off the o end of the electrical cord.  Both ends now have exposed wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on a MATCH.  Pull back to reveal Shepard lighting Phil's cigarette, then one for himself.  They are inside squad's coffee room now.  All eyes on the TV:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hadges is coming outta the dug out.  He's calling for the ball.  Can we get a shot of the ball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepard inhales deeply, sneaking a glance down hall at th closed interrogation room door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch looks past Julia, distracted, curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you excuse me for a second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia seems bewildered as Satch gets up out of the booth, making his way through the restaurant and towards the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, in full throttle, drags a chair against the wall. Climbs on the chair, uses a dime to unscrew the ELECTRICA CONDUCTOR BOX. He then unscrews the master fuse and SHOVES ONE END OF TH ELECTRICAL CORD'S EXPOSED WIRE AROUND THE FUSE CYLINDER. After re-tightening the fuse, and careful not to touch th other end of the cord, he jumps off the chair. FOOTSTEPS.  Frank freezes.  Someone's walking down the ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wall to wall cops.  Mesmerized by the game, especially Ph

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a scuff mark on the ball!  The umpire has reversed his decision.  He's sending Jones to first base!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops erupt.  Cheering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling over the noise) You mind I go back at teh fire boy for a while?  I won't lay a hand on him, just want to see what he's got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, knock yourself out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepard gives Phil one last smile, then slips out - casua heading down the hall...towards the interrogation room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, sweating bullets now, takes the two coffee cups of the table and pours their contents ON THE FLOOR.  The cof forms a SMALL PUDDLE which Frank is careful not to let sl over the door saddle. He puts the cups down.  Then opens the cabinet, rifling through, finding a can of LYSOL spray. Sounds of cops cheering filter in under the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch is riveted to the TV as Clendenon steps up to the plate.  Strike on. Satch jumps - Julia has come up behind him, touching him the shoulder.  She looks mad: how the hell can he be watc the ball game at a time like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on, Satch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dumbfounded) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes on the TV.  Another strike to Clendenon.  0-2 co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door knob turns.  The door half-opens.  Shepard stick his head in, scanning the room.  He relaxes a bit when he sees Frank sitting quietly at the table. Shepard opens the door a little further, takes a half ste into the room...and into the puddle of coffee! Frank raises his arm.  He's holding the live electrical c Shepard: What the fuck?  Frank flicks the cord...which la like a snake at Shepard's feet...in the puddle of coffee. 5,000 volts surge through Shepard's body. SPARKS AND SMOKE SHOOT OUT OF CONDUCTOR BOX...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON TV.  Clendenon still up.  1-2 count.  The wind u But something is wrong with the TV.  A spark shoots out o the back of the set. And then the entire 17th Precinct goes DARK.  Frank has shorted out the electrical system. The cops look at each other in a moment of pissed confusi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank lunges over the table, smashing a wooden chair over Shepard's head.  He's in overdrive.  Kicking the still li cord out of the coffee puddle, he then drags Shepard's bo into the room, shutting the door. Frank quickly rips off Shepard's SPORTS JACKET, pocketing Shepard's WALLET and BADGE. And then, moving very fast, Frank grabs the LYSOL can and matches Phil left on the table.  He LIGHTS A MATCH and ho it IN FRONT OF THE LYSOL CAN.  He points the can at the ceiling - at the FIRE ALARM SENSORS.  Hits SPRAY button - Professional Fire Fighter ingenuity - HOMEADE BLOW TORCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIRE ALARMS sound off.  SPRINKLER SYSTEM kicks in, water gushing from the ceiling.  Cops begin to move, investigat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank cracks open the door and slips out.  As the door closes, Shepard's eyes pop open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sprinklers rain down on Frank as he moves down the hall. Through the darkness he can see someone coming. It's Phil Frank covers his face...searching for a place to disappea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody breathes.  All eyes on the TV. The count is now 2-2.  The pitch is a high fastball. Clendenon takes a massive swing.  He nails it.  HOME RUN! The coffee shop breaks into cheers.  Everyone screaming t heads off.  Everyone except Satch, who just stands there, complete and utter shock.  Julia looking at him questioningly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling over the madness) He was right!  Everything he said.  He was telling the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you believe him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I do.  You bet your life I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they hug.  The weight of the world sliding off Julia' shoulders.  But someone is trying to get Satch's attentio It is the counter man, he's holding a phone. Satch takes the phone, beat, his face goes ashen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on my way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops the phone, heading for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Julia) Wait here, I'll send a uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Satch is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power is still off.  Sprinklers still gushing.  Amidst th chaos, a bathroom door swings open.  A man steps out.  A Leather jacket, gold shield.  It's Frank.  He slips throu the madness, heading down the hall and towards the stairs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch races down the crowded block...dodging celebrating Mets' fans...bolting up the precinct steps into the house

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil runs in.  Scanning the room.  But it is empty.  No Frank.  No Shepard.  Just a puddle of coffee on the floor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch charges into the lobby.  The lights start to flicke back on.  Chaos giving way to order. Satch heads for the stairs. And there is Frank, wearing Shepard's jacket and shield. in his hurry, Satch has not spotted him. Frank quickly steps behind a pillar as Satch tears by him up the stairs. Stay with Frank as he turns...calmly walking by the Sergeant's desk, gliding out the precinct door and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...disappearing into the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (little smile) Elvis has left the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stalks down an apartment building hallway, gun drawn reaches a door.  Two locks and a bell.  Fuck 'em.  John smashes his bulk into the door...one...two...three times. bursts off its hinges.  John charges in. Place is empty.  Like somebody got the hell out in a hurr A few odds and ends left behind in the haste...including pile of unpaid bills.  CARL SHEPARD. John's eyes glaze over in rage and fury.  But then he see something that makes him stop and think.  There is a telephone on the floor, in a corner.  John stares at the phone, wheels spinning.  He reaches in his coat and takes his notebook.  Flipping through pages.  Notes on Shepard: social security, address, DMV registration, and a series phone numbers...home, office, cellular. John runs to the phone.  Punches in the cell number.  Rin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone) Hell-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the right to remain silent.  If you give up that right...

dialogues.speaker: SHEPARD AND JOHN
dialogues.text: Shepard is in his car, over a bridge, on the run...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you say can and will be used against you in a court of law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullivan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the right to speak to an att --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a small world, Carl.  And I'm gonna find you.  Real soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK, CLICK -- dead bolt turning... Front door opens and SHEPARD WALKS IN.  His '69 apartment far nicer than the place we just left John in '98. Shepard runs to the bathroom.  Rips off the toilet's tank lid, reaches down and pulls out a .357 Magnum Colt Python wrapped in clear plastic. He rips off the plastic, shoves the pistol in his waistba heads into the kitchen. He gropes behind the refrigerator, close on an envelope g taped to back of the fridge.  Shepard's hand finds the envelope...he rips it loose.  And then he opens it - revealing its contents, souvenirs, POLAROID PHOTOS OF THE

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTINGALE MURDERS, WOMEN'S JEWELRY, NEWSPAPER CLIPPINGS
dialogues.text: Shepard takes out a match to burn the photos.  But then.. The broom closet door bursts off its hinges.  Frank insta on top of Shepard.  The souvenirs go flying in the air. Frank pummels Shepard's head and back. But Shepard smashe his elbow in Frank's Adam's apple, lands a solid uppercut square on Frank's nose.  Frank's eyes watering up, VISION BLURRING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's hand, groping for the handle of a glass pitcher a the kitchen counter. Shepard reaches for his gun, points the .357 at Frank's h Shepard's finger squeezing the trigger. It's over.  But.. FRANK SMASHES THE GLASS PITCHER down on Shepard's skull. Shepard drops.  CRACK, the gun fires, BLASTING AIR. FRANK scrambles for the window.  He's outta there, expert thundering down fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank hits the pavement, twisting his ankle.  Hears metal rattling, looks up.  Shepard's clattering down after him. Shepard tries to get off a shot through the fire escape g BANG!  The shot ricochets wildly.  Frank takes off, limpi and staying close to the building out of the line of fire The streets are still empty, the city glued to their TV's Frank hits CPW.  He glances left, right, straight ahead. Central Park. Frank runs into the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is kicked open.  Satch and Phil enter, guns draw They take in the damage from the fight.  Following the tr of blood back to the kitchen. And there, strewn across th floor are Shepard's photos of his victims, the newspaper clippings, the jewelry, and the envelope with the glass t still on it. Satch knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank hears pounding footsteps - Shepard is catching up. Frank's adrenaline kicking in, sprints around a bend in t path, reaches long wooden bridge spanning Central Park La The bridge is being restored.  Barricades across the entrance. Frank hurdles over the barricades, runs onto the bridge. Shepard trips in the dirt.  Gets back up, reaches the bri knocks over a barricade, runs to the middle of the bridge FRANK'S DISAPPEARED.  Shepard stops, listens - nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank dangles below the bridge, holding onto the steel gi of substructure - 8 ft. above water.  Not moving a muscle not making a sound, barely even breathing.

dialogues.speaker: SEWER RAT
dialogues.text: Crawling on Frank's arm.  Caught off guard, Frank flinche sending the rat tumbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge side railings have been removed for construction. Shepard hears something hit the water.  Rushes to the sid the bridge, points his gun at the water.  BANG! Shepard leans out further aiming the gun at the water. Shepard's outstretched arm only a few feet from Frank's h Frank silently swings his body forward reaching out... Snags Shepard's arm, pulling him hard, over the side. SHEPARD FALLS, grabs for something, anything.  Wraps his around Frank's leg, hangs on tight. Frank struggles, kicks wildly, trying to shake Shepard of Shepard hangs on with his left arm.  Pulls out the gun wi his right.  He aims it at Frank's head.  Cocks back the hammer. FRANK LETS GO.  KERPLUNK.  They plunge into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murky water, thick with dirt and slime, 5' deep. Frank's hanging on to Shepard's arm, trying to wrestle th gun free.  But Shepard's using his free hand to gouge Fra eyes.  Frank bites down hard on Shepard's wrist. The gun sinks silently to the muddy lake bottom. But Shepard gets both hands on Frank's throat.  Shoving h head into the shallow water.  Shepard's grip is like a vi Frank futilely tries to pry Shepard's fingers open. Frank is blinded by polluted water.  Starting to lose consciousness.  Desperately, he searches the muddy lake bottom for the gun.  But he's getting weaker, fading out. Then he feels something.  A BRICK, fallen off the bridge, half buried in the mud.  Frank struggles to dig it up. Summons his last ounces of strength, yanking it back and forth, it's getting loose. But Shepard's hands are squeezing tighter.  Frank finally goes limp.  A few last bubbles float to the surface.  She smiles.  Catching his breath, slightly loosens grip on Frank's lifeless neck. Frank springs off the lake bottom, rises out of the water like a jack-in-the-box.  Holding the brick with both hand he swings.  CONTACT. The brick smashes against Shepard's head.  Knocking him t yesterday.  He drops like a rock. Frank waits for Shepard to come up for air.  Nothing. Frank crawls out of the water, collapsing onto the embankment.  He just lies there, heart pounding, chest heaving. And suddenly, Frank is startled by a MASSIVE ROAR - the s of eight million New Yorkers screaming in unison.  The Me have just won the World Series. Frank laughs, slowly getting to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's dripping blood and filthy lake water.  The street have instantly erupted with celebrating Mets' fans.  A gi party.  Cars whiz by, honking their horns, passengers lea out, pumping fists in victory.  Frank has to yell above t racket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone) 17th Precinct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Deleon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone) Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nightingale evidence from Shepard's kitchen floor is spread all over the squad room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deleon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch, you gotta listen to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank.  We know.  We know it's Shepard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kidding.  I'm on the corner of 65th and CPW.  Come get me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank clicks down the receiver, slides in a dime, dials another number.  A beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank smiles, and we dissolve to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The area cordoned off.  Detectives and uniforms.  EMS wag An inflatable boat is being placed in the lake.  Two poli frog men are climbing into their gear. Pan over the scene to find Frank and Satch.  Frank's got blanket wrapped around him.  They talk quietly as Satch w Frank to a waiting green and white squad car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You missed a hell of a game, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time lets put some money on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the uniform driver) Get him home safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satch sticks out his hand...Frank takes it.  They hold ea other's grip for some moments.  Frank starts to say "than you", but Satch silently cuts him off. Frank climbs in the car.  Satch closes the door, taps on roof, Frank is on his way home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY is asleep in bed.  Elvis sleeps at the foot of it. the shadows next to them, Julia sits very still in a rock chair, half-asleep, half-awake.  Staring out the window. eyes are bloodshot.  She has been through hell. A faint STAIRWAY CREAK.  Elvis stirs.  He looks up to SEE FRANK standing in the doorway.  He looks a wreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she is out of the chair.  They meet in a hug.  Over h shoulder Frank takes a long look at his sleeping son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relatively cleaned up, but very bruised, Frank is at the desk, trying to repair the DISASSMBLED RADIO.  Julia come and sets down a cup of coffee.  She kisses him on the top his head, casts a wondering eye on the radio, and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pulls into the driveway and stops.  He stares out th window, exhausted.  And then something catches his attent A SOUND.  Coming from inside the house.  The HAM RADIO? He bolts from the car, runs to the door, scrambles to get backdoor key into the lock, as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the HAM) John, John?  You there?  Johnny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John barrels into the kitchen, leaving door ajar, and run

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John hits the squawk bar on the HAM which...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here, Dad.  I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did it, John.  We stopped him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short pause, John looks confused.  He sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.  Something's wrong.  I don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember.  Why don't I remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK!  CLOSE ON FRANK, the back of his skull smashed by butt of a .45 wielded by CARL SHEPARD. FRANK hits the floor with a thud, Shepard looming over hi reaching for a set of handcuffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?  Dad?  What's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK!  The butt of a .45 smashes the back of JOHN's skul He tumbles to the floor...fighting to stay conscious. CARL SHEPARD stands over him, the gun pointing at his hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My turn to steal your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepard stands over Frank.  Frank tires to struggle up. Shepard forces him back down, tromping a boot into his ch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a clever fuck, fireboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he snaps a handcuff on one of Frank's wrists then wrenches him to a steel radiator in the family room where circles the pipe to the floor with the handcuff chain and attaches the other cuff to Frank's other wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is woozy.  He reaches down to his holster - it is em Shepard has got John's 9mm in his left hand.  Holding the to John's head, Shepard pops the clip out of the 9mm and tosses it aside.  He then snaps a handcuff around John's wrist, begins dragging him to the radiator. John's FOOT ERUPTS up into Shepard's groin.  The .45 goes flying across the room.  For a suspended moment, both men riveted to the .45 spinning on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, struggling to breathe, is slumped by the radiator staring up at Shepard's groin.  The .45 goes flying acros the room.  For a suspended moment, both men are riveted t the .45 spinning on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, struggling to breathe, is slumped by the radiator staring up at Shepard, who is staring back with pure mena The SOUND OF A SHOWER can be heard upstairs.  Shepard loo up.  Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to meet the family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling to breathe) This is between you and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia luxuriates in a steaming shower.  Singing, softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BRUTAL STRUGGLE FOR THE GUN between John and Shepard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank desperately tugs at the handcuffs.  Steel bites dow his wrists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia smiles as she sees a figure through the curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Bud.  Want to join me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the shower curtain flies open to reveal SHEPARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia lets out a bloodcurling scream and plasters herself against the shower wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank reacts to the scream and tears with everything he h in him to rip away from the radiator.  No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny stirs awake at the sound of the scream...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Shepard are in a desperate TUG OF WAR over the g They KICK viciously at each other.  Butting heads.  But J is still woozy from the head wound and Shepard is still v strong.  BANG!  The gun goes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia is paralyzed against the wall.  Staring into the de as-marble eyes of Shepard.  He looks her up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's wrists are bleeding.  He can't get out.  But then sees something.  Something he can use.  His WATCH.  Frank struggles to unfasten the watch strap.  He does it.  He pinches the metal clasp with his thumb and forefinger and guides it to the keyhole in the left handcuff.  He works Nothing.  Then CLICK.  He's out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Shepard fight furiously.  But John has managed to ge control of the .45's TRIGGER.  He squeezes it.  BANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepard's hands are moving towards Julia's breasts.  SUDD she lashes out, DIGGING HER NAILS DEEP INTO SHEPARD'S FACE...TEARING FLESH, DRAWING BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON SHEPARD, struggling with John.  A LARGE SCAR ETC ONTO HIS FACE, in the exact spot where Julia dug her nail 29-years ago.  BANG!!  BANG!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepard grabs Julia by the throat.  Slams her against the wall, knocking her unconscious onto the shower floor.  He touches the GASH on his face, stares at the blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG!  BANG!  John keeps squeezing that trigger. CLICK.  CLICK.  No more bullets. Shepard lets go of the gun, heave John over and grabs him the neck...strangling him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepard is on top of Julia in the shower.  He uncoils the garrote, snaps it taut, and starts around her neck. And then a SOUND.  Instantly recognizable.  Beyond adequa description.  But once you've heard it, you don't forget it...

dialogues.speaker: SHOTGUN RATCHETING AROUND THE CORNER.
dialogues.text: Shepard's head spins about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your fucking hands off my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.  Don't do it, Frank.  You're not a killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is right.  Frank hesitates.  Shepard LUNGES, grabbing shotgun barrel. BOOM!  Frank FIRES.  BUCKSHOT RIPS THROUGH THE AIR. SHEPARD'S RIGHT HAND EXPLODES...blood spattering everywhe Like a wounded animal, Shepard bolts, blowing past Frank. Frank gently wraps Julia in a towel.  The fading sound of Shepard thundering down the stairs.  Out the door. And then softer footsteps.  Coming closer.  Johnny appear the doorway.  Safe and sound.

dialogues.speaker: IN SHOCK AS HIS HAND BEGINS TO DISFIGURE.
dialogues.text: John starts to choke back to life... And then something happens.  Some kind of SHOCK-WAVE ripp through the house -- bending light - bizarrely distorting everything in its path, including Shepard and John. The shock-wave is over.  But the house is different. Changed. Shepard scans the changed room - disoriented, bewildered. CRASH!  John pounces.  Pounding blows to Shepard's head. John is on top of Shepard, hands on his neck.  As John squeezes the life out of him, Shepard struggles to reach his leg with his good hand... There's something down there.  An ankle holster.  Shepard strains to get his hand on the gun.  He does. In a flash, Shepard has the gun to John's temple. CLICK.  Shepard cocks back the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were the kid.  I remember now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeping the gun pressed against John's temple, Shepard ge to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this time, no Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John closes his eyes.  It's over, he knows he's gonna die SILENCE.  Then a sound.  A sound we've heard before.  A s you never forget.  Music to our ears.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTGUN RATCHETING A ROUND IN THE CHAMBER.
dialogues.text: Shepard looks up to see: MAN HOLDING SHOTGUN. B-O-O-O-M: SHOTGUN BLAST:  Buckshot ripping into Shepard. Impact lifting him off his feet.  He lands dead on the fl

dialogues.speaker: JOHN'S FACE
dialogues.text: Opening his eyes.  Looking up at the doorway.  Blinking through shotgun smoke, trying to focus.  Not believing wh he sees.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: John looks up at his father, speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still here, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: We are soaring high above a baseball diamond.  Clear ligh air, you can see for miles.  Float down to the field... The first taste of Spring and Softball.  Picnic baskets. Flowers.  Kites flying.  Children running. The bleachers filled with families and loved ones. Among them sits SAMANTHA.  She's smiling, she's glowing...she's pregnant.  PULL BACK to reveal SATCH, GOR ELLEN & GORDY JR.  A dalmation puppy scampers at their fe barking in recognition as... Frank Sullivan steps into the batter's box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pitcher: 22 year-old African-Amerasian, a muscular beanpo Embroidered on the back of the his FDNY jersey is his nickname: PHIRE POWER. Quick shot of first baseman.  GRAHAM GIBSON - once a nerv PROBIE, now a seasoned vet.  And one hell of proud father

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to pitcher) Take it easy on him son, he's older than Moses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sneers at Gib, then glances up at GIB's WIFE in the bleachers.  She looks familiar, it's the girl Frank saved the warehouse 29-years ago. PHIRE POWER twirls his arm... Frank takes a big swing...contact...the ball fouls back behind the plate.  Towards the parking lot.  Where among old Chevys and Fords sits a brand new MERCEDES.  The cust license plate reads: YAHOO. CRASH!  Frank's foul ball comes down hard.  As the Merced windshield spiderwebs we hear an off-camera scream... It is Gordo, jumping up, running across the field.  From parking lot his eyes meet Frank's.  An I'M SORRY shrug, a Frank turns his attention back to the game. The next pitch is high and outside. Frank takes a looping swing...driving the ball to the gap right center.  Frank jogs to first.  An easy single. From first, Frank glances over at the third base coach: JULIA.  Her hair pinned up under a Mets cap, Julia puts t fingers in her mouth and belts out a loud whistle as... The next batter steps out of the dugout.  It is John Sullivan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John as he makes his way to the plate. Check out his eyes: they're different, he looks like his father.  They've got that Frank Sullivan sparkle. John steps into the batter's box, cocks back to wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring me home, son!  Bring me home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHIRE POWER uncorks the fastest softball pitch you've eve seen.  John jumps on it.  Rips a massive shot to deep cen way over the fence. The crew in the stands are on their feet, cheering. Frank rounds third, John catches up.  A double high-five Julia and they jog home together.  The game is over. Frank puts his arm around John.  Heading for the bleacher A little boy totters up to them.  Jumping into John's arm His name is Frank Jr.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John gives his son a kiss, glances up at Samantha in the bleachers.   They share a smile.  And as they step off th field, his little boy reaches up, takes John's hat off hi head and puts it on his own...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elvis has left the building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's face.  In his eyes, bliss. CUE Bruce Springsteen's: TAKE ME OUT TO THE BALLGAME.

dialogues.speaker: END CREDITS ROLL OVER
dialogues.text: Archival film footage.  1969 World Series.  Game Five.  T last pitch.  Mets win.  Shea stadium erupts.  Fans stream onto the field.  Lifting the players on their heads. The madness continues for a while, then slowly fade to Fi Ave.  Mets' ticker tape parade.  It's a hell of a party.
